sources.title: Night Has A Thousand Eyes (1948) Edward G. Robinson, Gail Russell
sources.description: Night Has a Thousand Eyes is a 1948 FILM NOlR , starring Edward G. Robinson and directed by John Farrow. The screenplay was written by Barré Lyndon and Jonathan Latimer. The film is based on the novel of the same name by Cornell Woolrich, originally published under the pseudonym George Hopley.   You can find out more about this movie from Wikipedia .

sources.title: Night Has a Thousand Eyes (1948)
sources.description: "Night Has a Thousand Eyes" is a 1948 horror film directed by John Farrow , featuring a star-studded cast including Edward G. Robinson , Gail Russell , and John Lund . Based on Cornell Woolrich's novel, the film blends elements of film noir with supernatural themes.  The film opens with Elliott Carson (played by John Lund ) preventing his girlfriend Jean Courtland (played by Gail Russell ) from committing suicide by jumping in front of a train. Their troubled relationship takes a turn when they meet John Triton (played by Edward G. Robinson ), a former psychic who claims to have the ability to predict future events. John recounts his past experiences with clairvoyance, revealing that he foresaw tragedies, including the death of Jean's father, Whitney Courtland . Despite efforts to avert disaster, Triton's attempts seem to lead to more turmoil, creating a tense atmosphere as Jean becomes increasingly anxious about her fate. With feelings of fear mounting, she becomes more reliant on John's prophecies, raising questions about fate, free will, and the nature of clairvoyance.

metadata.Plot: After heiress Jean Courtland attempts suicide, her fiancé Elliott Carson probes her relationship to John Triton. In flashback, we see how stage mentalist Triton starts having terrifying flashes of true precognition. His partner, Whitney Courtland, uses Triton's talent to make money; but Triton's inability to prevent what he foresees, causes him to break up the act and become a hermit. Years later, Triton has new visions and desperately tries to prevent tragedies in the Courtland family. Can his warnings succeed against suspicion, unbelief, and inexorable fate?
metadata.Writer: Barré Lyndon, Jonathan Latimer, Cornell Woolrich
metadata.Actors: Edward G. Robinson, Gail Russell, John Lund
